channel.title: Classes on Data Science for Public Management

item.title: Wrapping up and going beyond the basics
item.description: a.sourceLine { display: inline-block; line-height: 1.25; } a.sourceLine { pointer-events: none; color: inherit; text-decoration: inherit; } a.sourceLine:empty { height: 1.2em; } .sourceCode { overflow: visible; } code.sourceCode { white-space: pre; position: relative; } div.sourceCode { margin: 1em 0; } pre.sourceCode { margin: 0; } @media screen { div.sourceCode { overflow: auto; } } @media print { code.sourceCode { white-space: pre-wrap; } a.sourceLine { text-indent: -1em; padding-left: 1em; } } pre.

item.title: Inference, regression, and stories
item.description: Contents Slides Clearest and muddiest things Slides Download the slides from today’s lecture: PDF (best option) PowerPoint Clearest and muddiest things Go to this form and answer these three questions: What was the muddiest thing from class today? What are you still wondering about? What was the clearest thing from class today? What was the most exciting thing you learned?

item.title: Data wrangling with the Tidyverse II
item.description: Contents Slides 2016 elections, food security, and mortality Setting up your project Questions Clearest and muddiest things Slides Download the slides from today’s lecture: PDF (best option) PowerPoint 2016 elections, food security, and mortality Setting up your project (Practice makes perfect!) Do the following: Create a new RStudio project named “elections-food-death” (or something) and put it somewhere on your computer.

item.title: Data wrangling with the Tidyverse I
item.description: Contents Slides Answer your own questions Setting up your project Questions Clearest and muddiest things Slides Download the slides from today’s lecture: PDF (best option) PowerPoint Answer your own questions (Well, my questions for now—but still.) Setting up your project (Practice makes perfect!) Do the following: Create a new RStudio project named “birds” and put it somewhere on your computer.

item.title: Tidy data
item.description: Contents Slides In-class democracy example Clearest and muddiest things Slides Download the slides from today’s lecture. In-class democracy example Here’s the code I wrote in class: democracy.Rmd The knitted democracy.html Clearest and muddiest things Go to this form and answer these three questions: What was the muddiest thing from class today? What are you still wondering about? What was the clearest thing from class today?

item.title: Data visualization
item.description: Contents Slides In-class examples Guessing the identity of the Trump resistance op-ed writer with R Visualizing Hurricane Florence’s storm surge Clearest and muddiest things Slides Download the slides from today’s lecture. In-class examples Here’s the code and data we’ll be working with in class. These are also accessible in RStudio.cloud. Movies and the 5 named graphs: movies-5ng.zip Bird collisions at the SLC airport: airport-birds.

item.title: Data science, statistics, and public administration
